item.title: Halo Remake Creators Don't Deny AI Usage
item.description:
Leading members of Halo: Campaign Evolved 's creative team have declined to deny recent questions about whether generative AI is being used in development of the upcoming campaign-focused FPS game. The remake of Microsoft's iconic Halo: Combat Evolved is getting a lot of attention from the community for a lot of different reasons, but anti-AI gamers may still be hesitant following recent comments.

After what seemed like endless rumors, confirmation of a remake of the original Halo game from 2001 was made during the 2025 Halo World Championships on October 24. Scheduled for release sometime in 2026, not only will this remake mark the return of the first major hit for the Xbox brand, but it will be the first time that a Halo game has been made available on a PlayStation console.

Generative AI in Halo Remake is Still Unclear

While the announcement has generated a lot of buzz for Microsoft, recent statements from two of its top figureheads have drawn suspicion that Halo: Campaign Evolved might be developed using AI tools, which comes amid reports that both Xbox and PlayStation are using generative AI for game development. As pointed out by prominent Halo leaker Rebs Gaming on Twitter, both game director Greg Hermann and executive producer Damon Conn seemed to avoid either directly confirming or denying the use of generative AI in the upcoming Halo title when asked about it by Rolling Stone. In a recently published article based on that interview, Conn responded to a question by stating that video games are developed by creative people, but he added that if "there’s an opportunity to improve a workflow, or something along those lines, we’ll look at it again."

Hermann reportedly stepped in after the team was pressed for a more precise answer about the potential of generative AI usage in Halo: Campaign Evolved 's development. While his statement also didn't amount to a simple "yes" or "no," his comments seemed to call the question of what counts as generative AI usage at Microsoft, stating that the team uses the generative fill features of Adobe Photoshop and calling AI "a tool in a toolbox" that human creators can use to aid them in game creation.

These statements add some confusion over whether generative AI will be used to develop Halo: Campaign Evolved . Earlier in October, Xbox industry insider Jez Corden stated that the team behind the Halo remake was not using generative AI in its game development or creation of assets, and that Microsoft did not have a mandate requiring any of its development studios to incorporate AI. The last part of that claim was reiterated to the interviewer by an Xbox representative who reached out following the interview. Conversely, in response to the recent article, Rebs Gaming is interpreting the comments to indicate that generative AI is being used to improve workflow at the development studio, but not necessarily to generate any finished in-game assets.

Halo: Campaign Evolved

Source: Rolling Stone

item.title: The 4 Biggest Xbox Game Pass Games of 2026 Are Just the Tip of the Iceberg
item.description:
Xbox Game Pass subscribers can look forward to at least four big games from Microsoft itself in 2026, but there will be plenty more games added to the service next year. 2025 has been a year of highs and lows for Xbox Game Pass. On one hand, this year has seen Xbox Game Pass treated to some of its absolute best day one games ever with titles like GOTY frontrunner Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and the beloved Metroidvania Hollow Knight: Silksong . On the other hand, the Xbox Game Pass price increase has been met with significant backlash.

Microsoft recently announced that the price of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate would be increasing to $30 per month. This triggered widespread outrage from subscribers, despite Microsoft's efforts to justify the increase by adding a slew of fresh games (including 2023 best-seller Hogwarts Legacy ) and promising more day one games each year. Microsoft has committed to adding over 75 day one games to the Ultimate tier of Xbox Game Pass in 2026, and while many have yet to be announced, we do know of at least four massive games on the way for the service next year.

In 2026, Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers can expect the big four Xbox franchises to grace the service as day one releases. Halo: Campaign Evolved will be coming to Game Pass day one in 2026 at an undetermined date, and it will be joined by the likes of the Gears of War prequel Gears of War: E-Day , the Japan-set open world racing game Forza Horizon 6 , and the long-awaited Fable reboot. None of these games have solid release dates yet, but with 2026 marking the 25th anniversary of Xbox, Microsoft is going big by making sure its flagship franchisees are represented with new releases that will debut as day one Game Pass games.

But Fable , Gears of War: E-Day , Halo: Campaign Evolved , and Forza Horizon 6 are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to new games coming to Game Pass in 2026. We know that Menace will be joining PC Game Pass on February 5, and we also know that High on Life 2 is coming on February 13. Otherwise, no other Game Pass games for 2026 have specific release dates. But even so, we do know of some Game Pass games that are at least planned to release next year.

New Xbox Game Pass Games Confirmed for 2026

  • Menace - February 5
  • High on Life 2 - February 13
  • Aphelion
  • At Fate's End
  • Beast of Reincarnation
  • Beastro
  • Denshattack
  • Fable (2026)
  • Forza Horizon 6
  • Freestyle Football 2
  • Gears of War: E-Day
  • Halo: Campaign Evolved
  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault (console)
  • Persona 4 Revival
  • Planet of Lana 2
  • Replaced
  • Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy
  • Subnautica 2
  • Super Meat Boy 3D
  • There Are No Ghosts at the Grand
  • Tropico 7
  • Wildekin

Besides the four big Xbox-published games and the two titles that have specific dates, there are already a bunch of other new day one Xbox Game Pass games to look forward to in 2026. At Fate's End , Denshattack , Persona 4 Revival , Replaced , Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy , Subnautica 2 , and Super Meat Boy 3D are the ones that catch my eye, personally. But remember, there are over 75 day one games coming to Game Pass in 2026, and only 22 have been announced so far. Clearly, there will be a lot of day one Xbox Game Pass games to look forward to next year, but whether they justify the price increase remains to be seen.

item.title: Roblox: Garden Clicker Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Garden Clicker is a fun Roblox game where you can earn money by clicking on your fruits. The experience allows you to improve your economy in several ways and choose your preferred playstyle. You can increase the amount of Sheckles you get with each click, or purchase special upgrades that give you money every second. However, all these features are not cheap, so in this guide, we will tell you about Garden Clicker codes that will reward you with some useful freebies.

All Garden Clicker Codes

Working Garden Clicker Codes

  • HALLOWEEN – Gives you Sheckles and Pumpkins.
  • BugFixes – Gives you Sheckles.
  • UPDATE3 – Gives you Sheckles.
  • UPDATE2 – Gives you Sheckles.
  • UPDATE1 – Gives you Sheckles.
  • Release – Gives you Sheckles.

Expired Garden Clicker Codes

Currently, there are no expired Garden Clicker codes. We will update this paragraph if any of these coupons become unavailable to you and other players.

Garden Clicker codes can provide you with a decent amount of Sheckles, which are the main currency in this game. With their help, you will be able to purchase different upgrades and increase your income. Use them wisely, and you will quickly develop your economy and earn even more money.

Promo codes in Roblox games tend to expire quickly, and we highly recommend that you redeem them as soon as possible. If you don’t claim your rewards in time, they may become unavailable.

How to Redeem Garden Clicker Codes

The rewards you can get by using Garden Clicker codes are really useful and can help you purchase a couple of high-tier upgrades. However, if you want to get them, you will have to learn how the redemption process works, and fortunately, it’s quite simple. Just follow these steps, and you will quickly redeem all available Garden Clicker codes:

  • Launch Garden Clicker and wait for the experience to load.
  • Once you are in the game, click on the Store button on the right side of your screen.
  • Scroll down the Shop menu until you see the line where you can type codes.
  • Enter the code you want to use.
  • Click on the Submit button.
  • The reward is yours.

How to Get New Garden Clicker Codes

The developers may add more promo codes in the future, and if this happens, we will update our article. Feel free to bookmark this guide and use it as a source of information about coupons in this game. Also, you can follow the official social media-related accounts of Garden Clicker :

  • Discord Server
Roblox
449
8.8 /10

September 1, 2006

item.title: What You Should Know Before Buying Arc Raiders
item.description: Arc Raiders is mere days away from launch, but there is a lot to know about the game, so we compiled some of the most important information that you need to know before you buy it. From the combat, to the monetization model, this guide should have you fully ready to reach the surface.

item.title: Every Open-World Game Coming Out In November 2025
item.description:
While some games will release in December, November 2025 will be the last really packed month. The year has already produced more than enough new open-world games to keep somebody busy until the end of 2026, but the releases will not stop coming. Compared to October's lineup, the upcoming month does not have as many big names; however, roughly the same number of projects are slated to drop, even if they are more niche.

Due to being more unknown, it is hard to predict which of the November 2025 open-world games will prove to be the pick of the bunch, and you might miss out on something that fits your preference due to the sheer volume of releases happening every single day. Therefore, let's go through all the confirmed titles slated for the month that will, hopefully, leave their mark on the genre.

Criteria & Notes:

  • The games are in release order.
  • Only games with confirmed release dates will be included.
  • Ports and expansions are listed separately.
  • Games that are unlikely to have 100% traditional open-worlds are listed separately.
  • No mobile games.

Tales of Old: Dominus

Open-World Medieval Game With Base Building

Tales of Old: Dominus
Adventure
Base Building
Stealth
Open-World
RPG
Systems
Released
November 3, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Hvmana Industries MMD
Publisher(s)
indie.io
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

An ambitious indie game that looks to combine a medieval fantasy setting with real-time action combat, stealth, RPG customization, and base building, Tales of Old: Dominus has garnered a bit of momentum throughout the year. The story is all about revenge, as you step into the shoes of a survivor who is looking to get back at the nobles responsible for burning down his home, a process that will see you lead a rebellion and revitalize villages. Tales of Old: Dominus sounds fantastic on paper, although it remains to be seen whether all of its elements combine to create a cohesive whole. A demo of an earlier build was temporarily released in May 2025, and it was rough but showed potential.

Honeycomb: The World Beyond

Survive In A Gorgeous Sandbox

Honeycomb: The World Beyond
Survival
Systems
Released
November 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Frozen Way
Publisher(s)
Snail Games USA, Frozen District
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Honeycomb: The World Beyond looks stunning, bringing to life an alien planet that has unique flora, fauna, and wildlife. Unlike many of its contemporaries, Honeycomb opts for vibrant and colorful visuals, along with a first-person perspective. As a bioengineer stranded on Sota7, your goal is not just to survive, but also to thrive, discover, learn, and create. Along with exploring this beautiful world and avoiding death, you will be able to expand your base of operations, so the game should have a base-building aspect.

Of Ash and Steel

An Action RPG In A Dark Fantasy Open-World

Of Ash and Steel
Indie
Action RPG
Adventure
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Fire & Frost
Publisher(s)
tinyBuild
Platform(s)
Steam
Powered by

One of November 2025's most highly anticipated open-world games , Of Ash and Steel takes cues from classic RPGs like Gothic , so expect a fairly difficult experience that does not try to walk you through the experience. With no marker system, the game requires players to explore a rundown medieval kingdom that has seen better days, while gradually mastering combat that features different stances and sk8ills. You will need to make allies, but also show caution to avoid an avoidable death. Of Ash and Steel incorporates survival elements, such as hunger, quite extensively, which may not be to everyone's taste.

Check out Of Ash and Steel 's demo if you are not sure if the game is for you.

BattleGroupVR2

A Universe In The Palm Of Your Hands

BattleGroupVR2
Virtual Reality
Action
Strategy
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 7, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
SpaceOwl Games
Publisher(s)
SpaceOwl Games
Platform(s)
PC, Meta Quest 2, Meta Quest 3, Meta Quest 3S, Meta Quest Pro
Powered by

Now, here is something wildly different from every other November 2025 open-world game . As suggested by its title, BattleGroupVR2 requires a virtual reality headset, and it will be coming to both Steam and Meta. People who played the first game probably know what to expect from the sequel, but BattleGroupVR2 should be impressive. This real-time strategy game not only puts you in a fleet's hot seat but also makes you engage in battles directly, requiring you to make decisions in the heat of the moment and not just as a god-like figure from above. Generally, RTS projects have open-ended maps rather than conventional open-worlds, but BattleGroupVR2 specifically promotes an open-world as a procedurally generated galaxy.

Check out BattleGroupVR2 's demo if you are not sure if the game is for you.

Sword of Justice

A Free Open-World MMO Makes The Jump From Mobile

Sword of Justice
Open-World
RPG
Action
MMO
Systems
Released
June 30, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
ZhuRong Studio
Publisher(s)
ZhuRong Studio
PC Release Date
November 7, 2025
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC
Powered by

While it has been available on Android and iOS devices since 2023, Sword of Justice will make its Steam debut on November 7, 2025. Proudly announcing that it is free of grind and Play-2-Win elements, this free-to-play game should have great visuals and a rich setting based on Eastern culture. Sword of Justice promises an experience that rewards both casual and competitive players, allowing everyone to pick a playstyle that works best for them. There is even an NPC companion system designed to allow solo players to tackle dungeons that would usually require a party. Sounds good to me.

Skopje '83

A Zombie Shooter With Roguelite World

Skopje '83
Open-World
Survival
Action
FPS
Systems
Released
November 7, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Dark-1
Publisher(s)
PM Studios
Multiplayer
Online Co-Op
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Standing out from the crowd with a comic book art style, Skopje '83 is eye-catching and has the potential to be among November 2025's nicest surprises. You must explore a zombie-infested city while upgrading a bus, collecting loot, and managing things like hunger, as this is a survival game (albeit with a story and a sense of mystery). An interesting feature is that the world should change whenever you die, so you cannot just repeat the same playthrough. It should help keep things fresh in the long run.

Check out Skopje '83 's demo if you are not sure if the game is for you.

Winter Burrow

The Most Adorable Open-World Game Protagonist Ever

Winter Burrow
Simulation
Survival
Adventure
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Pine Creek Games
Publisher(s)
Noodlecake
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

November 2025 has arguably too many open-world survival games, but you will not mistake Winter Burrow for any of the others. Similar to Don't Starve , the game is played from an isometric angle and drops players in the heart of a snow-laden wilderness, challenging them to craft, build, and live their best lives. Also, you play as (and customize) the most adorable mouse to ever exist, who is trying to fix up their home and find their missing aunt. Although part of the survival genre, the game is specifically aiming for a cozy vibe, so it should not be extremely hard.

Check out Winter Burrow 's demo if you are not sure if the game is for you.

Dynasthir

Soulslike Open-World Game

Dynasthir
Soulslike
Open-World
Action RPG
Systems
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
TM
Publisher(s)
PjG
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Dynasthir is going to try the hard task of combining Soulslike gameplay with open-world design, a blend that has only been attempted a couple of times by this point. Taking a no-hand-holding approach, the game will leave you to your own devices in a world that has no time for the living. While fairly typical for the Soulslike genre, the combat is quite fast-paced and varied, and the same can be said for the customization.

Check out Dynasthir 's demo if you are not sure if the game is for you.

Where Winds Meet

November 2025's Biggest Open-World Game

Where Winds Meet
Action RPG
Wuxia
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Everstone Studios
Publisher(s)
NetEase, Inc.
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PS5
Powered by

Without question, Where Winds Meet is November's most hyped-up open-world game, and it is not difficult to understand why. For one, Everstone and NetEase's game will be free-to-play, which will at least lower the barrier of entry and attract folks who might otherwise have been on the fence. Secondly, the action RPG has visuals that could put to shame most AAA projects, along with a beautiful world that takes players back to Ancient China. The rhythm-based wuxia combat looks to combine melee, ranged, and magic seamlessly, and the available footage showcases fluid movement and impactful animation. Honestly, Where Winds Meet looks almost too good to be true, but it will hopefully live up to its great potential.

Sacred 2 Remaster

Bringing Back An Action RPG Classic

Sacred 2 Remaster
Action RPG
Adventure
Hack and Slash
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 11, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
SparklingBit
Publisher(s)
THQ Nordic
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The last Sacred game came out in 2014, and Sacred 3 was not particularly well-regarded. Nowadays, the series is primarily remembered for Sacred 2 , a great Diablo -like hack-and-slash romp with a pretty huge world that can be explored relatively freely, by the standards of traditional isometric action RPGs. Sacred 2 Remaster will look to introduce the game to a new audience while providing the ultimate experience for die-hard fans craving a rerun.

Open-World Games Entering Early Access

Steam's Early Access Library Is About To Get A LOT Of New Open-World Games

  • Cursemark – November 3, 2025
  • The Last Caretaker – November 6, 2025
  • Dragonhold – November 10, 2025

A Few Smaller Open-World Games Should Be Coming To Valve's Store
